# Head of Personnel Well, well, well. If it isn't the one, the only, Head of Paperwork. Get your gloves on, rookie. The request forms won't write themselves.
The Head of Personnel is the head of the Service department as well as the manager of all the IDs on the station. Your duties include overseeing your chefs, bartenders and botanists as well as coordinating between the other departments and having them get along.
But most importantly-- [color=#a4885c]you change IDs[/color].
## Changing IDs To get started, you need your own ID, someone else's ID and an [color=#a4885c]ID card computer[/color].
Now, follow these steps. - First, put your ID into the computer. This is the [color=#a4885c]Privileged ID[/color], the one that has the ability to modify other cards. - Now, put in the ID you want to change. This is the [color=#a4885c]Target ID[/color]. You're modifying the access of this one. - Choose a preset. This will change the person's [color=#a4885c]job icon[/color] that will show up on secHUDs and the crew manifest. - If necessary, add or take away additional accesses. - Take out the IDs and make sure you don't accidentally hand someone else your own ID!
## Allowing Access You COULD give away acceesses willy-nilly, but your fellow department heads may not appreciate fresh faces walking into their departments without their permission.
Before assigning a job, at the bare minimum [color=#a4885c]notify[/color] the department head so that everyone is on the same page. Ideally, you should ask them over [color=#a4885c]radio[/color] if they approve or send them a letter for them to [color=#a4885c]stamp[/color].
How stringent your policy is up to you, but remember that some accesses could be [color=#a4885c]detrimental[/color] to the station should they fall into the wrong hands! This is why HoPs will often make job request forms for record-keeping.

Also check the wiki for additional tips and [color=#a4885c]templates[/color] that you can use.
## Replacing Lost Equipment Some poor shmuck came to your office without a PDA or a headset. Would hate to be that guy!
Thankfully, you can replace his lost devices using the PTech in your office.
If you're replacing their radio, you may need to give them spare encryption keys. These are also found in your PTech.

## Access Types
Command gives access to the bridge and the vault, but not department head rooms.
Brig gives access to security's lobby. Security gives access to Security equipment, excluding the Armory.
Service allows access into general service areas, but not specific service rooms as they have their own accesses, like the Bar.
Research allows into Science and Robotics. The R&D server is usually locked behind a Research Director airlock.
Medical does not allow access into Cryogenics or Chemistry, as they have their own accesses.
Engineering does not allow access into Atmospherics or outside the station, as they have their own accesses.
Cargo does not allow access into Salvage, as it has its own access.
Maintenance allows access into the maintenance shafts but not the substation rooms.
External access allows people to leave the station, either for a spacewalk or a one-way trip.
